page.title: 1920TH CENTURY NACKINGTON
page.content: {The Chaucer Hospital,}built on the edge of farmland, was opened in 1982. It provides private care as an alterna- tive to National Health Service hospitals. The hospital with 48 beds, has two operating theatres, an inten- sive care unit, and radiology and physiotherapy departments. All bedrooms have private shower and toilet,nurse-to-patient intercom and electrically operated beds. Food is of a high standard prepared by top class chefs for patients, staff and visitors. Visiting hours are flexible. About 200 staff are employed. Nursing staff are fully trained in the latest techniques. Fees are from Â£126 per day, plus surgeons' and treatment fees. There are insur- ance schemes to cover the cost of private hospital treatment and some employers offer this as a benefit.
